requirement_title: Enactment of the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023
article_text:
THE DIGITAL PERSONAL DATA PROTECTION ACT, 2023
(NO. 22 OF 2023)
[11th August, 2023.]
An Act to provide for the processing of digital personal data in a manner that
recognises both the right of individuals to protect their personal data and the
need to process such personal data for lawful purposes and for matters
connected therewith or incidental thereto.
BE it enacted by Parliament in the Seventy-fourth Year of the Republic of India as
follows:––
CHAPTER I
PRELIMINARY
1. (1) This Act may be called the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023.
(2)  It shall come into force on such date as the Central Government may, by notification
in the Official Gazette, appoint and different dates may be appointed for different provisions
of this Act and any reference in any such provision to the commencement of this Act shall
be construed as a reference to the coming into force of that provision.

requirement: The Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023 is enacted by Parliament.
requirement_description: This requirement signifies that a new law has been passed to regulate the processing of digital personal data.

controls.control_title: Ensure Compliance with Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023
controls.control: Develop and implement a comprehensive data protection program that adheres to the requirements of the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023
Collect only necessary and relevant personal data for the intended purpose and retain such data for limited periods as required by law or for business needs
Maintain accurate, complete, and up-to-date personal data in your possession or under your control and take appropriate measures to protect the integrity of such data

controls.control_title: Implement Data Access and Control Measures
controls.control: Provide individuals with reasonable access to their personal data, allow them to correct or amend inaccurate information, and provide mechanisms for the secure destruction of such data when it is no longer needed
Provide individuals with portable copies of their personal data in a machine-readable format and allow them to transmit this data to another data controller without hindrance
Establish procedures for the timely notification of individuals, supervisory authorities, and other relevant parties in case of a data breach

requirement_title: Processing of Digital Personal Data Within India
article_text:
3. Subject to the provisions of this Act, it shall—
(a) apply to the processing of digital personal data within the territory of India
where the personal data is collected––
(i) in digital form; or
(ii) in non-digital form and digitised subsequently;
(b) also apply to processing of digital personal data outside the territory of
India, if such processing is in connection with any activity related to offering of
goods or services to Data Principals within the territory of India;
Application
of Act.
requirement: The Act applies to the processing of digital personal data within India, whether it's originally in digital form or converted into digital format.
requirement_description: Organizations must comply with this requirement by ensuring that they follow the provisions of the Act when processing digital personal data within India.

controls.control_title: Ensure Compliance with Indian Data Protection Law
controls.control: Implement measures to ensure that all digital personal data processed within India complies with the relevant provisions of the applicable Indian data protection law.
Store and process digital personal data within India, unless an exception applies under the relevant Indian data protection law.

controls.control_title: Data Protection by Design and Default
controls.control: Integrate data protection principles into the design and development of systems and processes that handle digital personal data.
Conduct Data Protection Impact Assessments for high-risk processing activities involving digital personal data.

Establish procedures to handle requests from data subjects regarding their rights under the Indian data protection law, such as access, correction, erasure, and portability of their digital personal data.
Implement procedures for promptly notifying the relevant authorities and affected data subjects in case of a data breach involving digital personal data.

requirement: The Act applies to the processing of digital personal data outside India when it's connected to offering goods or services to individuals within India.
requirement_description: Organizations must comply with this requirement by ensuring that they follow the provisions of the Act when processing digital personal data outside India if it's related to offering goods or services to individuals within India.

controls.control_title: Ensure Compliance with Indian Data Protection Law
controls.control: Implement measures to ensure that the processing of digital personal data outside India complies with the requirements of the applicable Indian data protection law, particularly when offering goods or services to individuals within India.
Designate a Data Protection Officer (DPO) responsible for overseeing compliance with the Indian data protection law and acting as a point of contact for any related inquiries.

Provide mechanisms to allow individuals within India to exercise their rights under the Indian data protection law, such as accessing, correcting, erasing, or objecting to the processing of their personal data.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Data Protection Impact Assessments
controls.control: Perform regular Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs) to identify and mitigate potential privacy risks associated with the processing of personal data.

controls.control_title: Implement Appropriate Technical and Organizational Measures
controls.control: Adopt appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk, such as encryption, access controls, and regular backups.

Establish a data retention policy that ensures personal data processed for purposes outside of personal or domestic is deleted or anonymized when no longer required, in compliance with the Act.

Review and update company social media policies to clearly state that sharing personal data publicly may not be protected under certain acts or regulations.

article_text:
CHAPTER II
OBLIGATIONS OF DATA FIDUCIARY
4. (1) A person may process the personal data of a Data Principal only in accordance
with the provisions of this Act and for a lawful purpose,—
(a) for which the Data Principal has given her consent; or
(b) for certain legitimate uses.
(2) For the purposes of this section, the expression “lawful purpose” means any
purpose which is not expressly forbidden by law.
5. (1) Every request made to a Data Principal under section 6 for consent shall be
accompanied or preceded by a notice given by the Data Fiduciary to the Data Principal,
informing her,—
  (i) the personal data and the purpose for which the same is proposed to be
processed;
  (ii) the manner in which she may exercise her rights under sub-section (4) of
section 6 and section 13; and
 (iii) the manner in which the Data Principal may make a complaint to the Board,
in such manner and as may be prescribed.
Illustration.
X, an individual, opens a bank account using the mobile app or website of Y , a bank.
To complete the Know-Your-Customer requirements under law for opening of bank account,
X opts for processing of her personal data by Y in a live, video-based customer identification
process. Y shall accompany or precede the request for the personal data with notice to X,
describing the personal data and the purpose of its processing.
(2) Where a Data Principal has given her consent for the processing of her personal
data before the date of commencement of this Act,—
(a) the Data Fiduciary shall, as soon as it is reasonably practicable, give to the
Data Principal a notice informing her,––
(i) the personal data and the purpose for which the same has been
processed;
  (ii) the manner in which she may exercise her rights under sub-section (4)
of section 6 and section 13; and
 (iii) the manner in which the Data Principal may make a complaint to the
Board,
in such manner and as may be prescribed.

processing
personal data.
Notice.
requirement: Data must be processed for a lawful purpose, either with the Data Principal's consent or for legitimate uses.
requirement_description: The data fiduciary can only process personal data if it has the Data Principal's consent or for specific legitimate purposes.

controls.control_title: Obtain Informed Consent from Data Principals
controls.control: Ensure that data principals are fully informed about the purpose of data processing and provide explicit consent before any personal data is collected or processed

controls.control_title: Define Legitimate Uses for Data Processing
controls.control: Clearly define and document legitimate purposes for data processing, ensuring that these are in line with applicable laws and regulations
Establish appropriate access controls to ensure that only authorized personnel can access personal data for the intended purpose
Periodically review and update consent forms to ensure they are up-to-date, accurate, and transparent about data processing activities
Keep records of all data processing activities, including the purpose, type of data processed, and consent obtained (if applicable)

requirement: Obtain and maintain informed consent from the Data Principal for processing their personal data.
requirement_description: Entities must have explicit consent from individuals before processing their personal data. Consent can be withdrawn at any time.

controls.control: Develop a clear, concise, and easily understandable consent form that outlines the purpose, type, and duration of data processing.
Establish a system to record, store, and manage consents obtained from Data Principals. Ensure the records are easily accessible and up-to-date.
Offer an opt-out option for Data Principals who do not wish to share their personal data or have it processed in specific ways.
Regularly review and update consents to ensure they remain relevant, accurate, and up-to-date. Notify Data Principals of any changes and provide them with the opportunity to opt-out if necessary.

article_text:
SEC. 1] THE GAZETTE OF INDIA EXTRAORDINARY 5
(b) the Data Fiduciary may continue to process the personal data until and
unless the Data Principal withdraws her consent.
Illustration.
X, an individual, gave her consent to the processing of her personal data for an online
shopping app or website operated by Y, an e-commerce service provider, before the
commencement of this Act. Upon commencement of the Act, Y shall, as soon as practicable,
give through email, in-app notification or other effective method information to X, describing
the personal data and the purpose of its processing.
(3) The Data Fiduciary shall give the Data Principal the option to access the contents
of the notice referred to in sub-sections (1) and (2) in English or any language specified in
the Eighth Schedule to the Constitution.
requirement: Provide timely notice to Data Principals about the personal data being processed and its purpose.
requirement_description: Entities must inform individuals about their personal data processing activities as soon as possible after the commencement of the Act.

controls.control_title: Provide Timely Notice to Data Principals
controls.control: Develop and implement a process for notifying data principals about the personal data being processed, its purpose, and their rights in a clear, concise, and timely manner.

controls.control_title: Maintain Accurate Records of Data Processing Activities
controls.control: Keep records of all data processing activities, including the purpose for which personal data is processed, the categories of data subjects and recipients, and the duration of the processing.
Establish a procedure for data principals to request access to their personal data, including the right to be informed about its use, and ensure prompt response to such requests.

controls.control_title: Regularly Review and Update Notification Templates
controls.control: Regularly review and update notification templates to ensure they are clear, concise, and up-to-date with any changes in data processing activities or applicable laws.

requirement: Make data processing notices accessible in English and any regional languages specified in the Eighth Schedule of the Constitution.
requirement_description: Entities must provide Data Principals with the option to access notices about their personal data processing activities in multiple languages.

controls.control_title: Provide Data Processing Notices in Multiple Languages
controls.control: Develop and distribute data processing notices in English and all regional languages specified in the Eighth Schedule of the Constitution. Ensure that the content is clear, concise, and easily understandable.

Establish a system for translating data processing notices into regional languages. This may include hiring language experts or using translation software, ensuring accuracy and cultural appropriateness.
Maintain a database of translated data processing notices for easy access and distribution. Regularly review and update translations as necessary.

article_text:
6. (1) The consent given by the Data Principal shall be free, specific, informed,
unconditional and unambiguous with a clear affirmative action, and shall signify an
agreement to the processing of her personal data for the specified purpose and be limited to
such personal data as is necessary for such specified purpose.
Illustration.
X, an individual, downloads Y , a telemedicine app. Y requests the consent of X for (i)
the processing of her personal data for making available telemedicine services, and ( ii)
accessing her mobile phone contact list, and X signifies her consent to both. Since phone
contact list is not necessary for making available telemedicine services, her consent shall be
limited to the processing of her personal data for making available telemedicine services.
(2) Any part of consent referred in sub-section (1) which constitutes an infringement
of the provisions of this Act or the rules made thereunder or any other law for the time being
in force shall be invalid to the extent of such infringement.
Illustration.
X, an individual, buys an insurance policy using the mobile app or website of Y , an
insurer. She gives to Y her consent for (i) the processing of her personal data by Y for the
purpose of issuing the policy, and ( ii) waiving her right to file a complaint to the Data
Protection Board of India. Part ( ii) of the consent , relating to waiver of her right to file a
complaint, shall be invalid.
(3) Every request for consent under the provisions of this Act or the rules made
thereunder shall be presented to the Data Principal in a clear and plain language, giving her
the option to access such request in English or any language specified in the Eighth
Schedule to the Constitution and providing the contact details of a Data Protection Officer,
where applicable, or of any other person authorised by the Data Fiduciary to respond to
any communication from the Data Principal for the purpose of exercise of  her rights under
requirement: The consent given by the Data Principal must be free, specific, informed, unconditional, and unambiguous with a clear affirmative action.
requirement_description: Consent from the Data Principal must meet certain criteria to ensure it is valid and meaningful.

controls.control: Implement a system that captures explicit, affirmative consent from Data Principals. This could be through checkboxes or buttons labeled 'I agree'.

controls.control_title: Provide Detailed Information Prior to Consent
controls.control: Develop a comprehensive Privacy Policy that outlines the purpose, use, and duration of data processing. Make this information easily accessible before seeking consent.
Avoid making consent a prerequisite for accessing services or benefits, unless such consent is necessary and legitimate.
Keep records of consents given by Data Principals, including the purpose, scope, and duration of processing. Ensure these records are securely stored and regularly audited.
Regularly review and update the consent process to ensure it remains relevant, accurate, and up-to-date. This may include revisiting the Privacy Policy and obtaining fresh consents when necessary.

requirement: The scope of the Data Principal's consent is limited and cannot infringe upon the provisions of the Act, rules, or any other applicable laws.
requirement_description: The Data Principal's consent cannot exceed the bounds set by law.

controls.control: Ensure that the scope of Data Principal's consent is clearly defined and does not exceed the provisions of the Act, rules, or any other applicable laws.
Maintain detailed records of the scope of consent obtained from Data Principals to ensure compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
Periodically review and update the scope of consent to ensure it remains within the boundaries set by the Act, rules, or any other applicable laws.

requirement_title: Clear and Plain Language for Consent Requests

requirement: Consent requests must be presented in clear and plain language, with options for translation and contact information provided.
requirement_description: The Data Principal should easily understand the request for consent and have access to necessary information.

controls.control_title: Present Consent Requests in Clear Language
controls.control: Ensure all consent requests are written in clear, concise, and easy-to-understand language. Avoid using technical jargon or complex sentences.

controls.control_title: Provide Translation Options for Consent Requests
controls.control: Offer translation options in multiple languages to ensure that users who do not speak the primary language can understand and provide informed consent.

controls.control_title: Include Contact Information in Consent Requests
controls.control: Provide contact information for privacy officers, data protection authorities, or other relevant parties within the consent request. This allows users to ask questions or raise concerns about their personal data.
Design and implement user-friendly mechanisms for obtaining and managing consent. This includes using clear, intuitive interfaces that are easy to navigate.
